segments.text: Welcome to Daily Epoch, your daily dose
of AI news. Let's dive into today's top
stories. XAI
just launched Grock Business in
enterprise tiers while expanding its
Colossus Supercomput to nearly 2 GW.
Enough electricity for 2 million homes,
making it the world's most powerful AI
training cluster. South Korea's NCAI
consortium just released VAT, a 112
billion parameter open- source model
that's part of their sovereign AI
initiative. It's ane, meaning only 10
billion parameters activate at once, and
it was trained entirely on open data for
real world industrial use. Firecrawl
just added an agent endpoint to their
MCP server, the protocol that connects
AI assistance to external tools. Now
cursor and claude can autonomously
browse the web, turning multi-step data
extraction into a single command.
Alibaba cloud is now live with SQL
Server 2025, bringing native vector
search that uses disk ANN to/memory by
90% and letting you call AI models like
Quen directly from SQL queries.
Llama.cpp CPP just added NVIDIA's Music
Flamingo for local audio AI analysis,
plus new metal optimizations to boost
Mac performance. The update also fixes a
critical quantization bug that was
corrupting model files. Two new agent
frameworks just hit ARXIV.NF
tool uses a multi-agent role- playinging
system to synthesize infinite tool use
training data, boosting a 32 billion
parameter models accuracy on function
calling benchmarks from 19.8% 8% to
A 258% relative gain that rivals models
10 times its size. Swarms Corp. just
dropped Voice Agents, a productionready
Python library that unifies OpenAI, 11
Labs, and Grock into one realtime API
for building voice AI. It can even let
multiple agents talk to each other, like
their demo showing two philosopher bots
debating the meaning of life using
streaming speech. Peaking university's
UN group just released the full training
code for Ultrashape 1.0, a two-stage
pipeline that turns images into crisp,
watertight 3D models using Voxal
condition diffusion. Trained entirely on
public data, it democratizes
highfidelity 3D generation. Manis's new
Slack connector lets teams tag its AI
agents directly in threads, turning
channel discussions into productionready
reports, presentations, and spreadsheets
in minutes instead of hours. Vidu AI's
video agent is now worldwide, letting
anyone create professional videos in 20
languages using 200 voice styles. Just
input text or images, and it
autogenerates storyboards, scenes, and
voiceovers in one click. Microsoft Teams
Co-Pilot Chat is now generally
available. It automatically turns your
calls into AI generated summaries, and
action items right in the mobile app,
eliminating manual note-taking for good.
Nathan Barry just released Tiny
Diffusion version 2.0. shrinking the
entire diffusion model to just 350 lines
of code while adding a tiny GPT
implementation that shares 80% of the
same architecture.
The key difference is switching from
causal attention which predicts text one
token at a time to birectional attention
which lets the model denoise entire
sequences in parallel changing literally
one line of code. That's it for today's
daily epic AI news. Come back tomorrow
for more industry updates.

fullText: Welcome to Daily Epoch, your daily dose of AI news. Let's dive into today's top stories. XAI just launched Grock Business in enterprise tiers while expanding its Colossus Supercomput to nearly 2 GW. Enough electricity for 2 million homes, making it the world's most powerful AI training cluster. South Korea's NCAI consortium just released VAT, a 112 billion parameter open- source model that's part of their sovereign AI initiative. It's ane, meaning only 10 billion parameters activate at once, and it was trained entirely on open data for real world industrial use. Firecrawl just added an agent endpoint to their MCP server, the protocol that connects AI assistance to external tools. Now cursor and claude can autonomously browse the web, turning multi-step data extraction into a single command. Alibaba cloud is now live with SQL Server 2025, bringing native vector search that uses disk ANN to/memory by 90% and letting you call AI models like Quen directly from SQL queries. Llama.cpp CPP just added NVIDIA's Music Flamingo for local audio AI analysis, plus new metal optimizations to boost Mac performance. The update also fixes a critical quantization bug that was corrupting model files. Two new agent frameworks just hit ARXIV.NF tool uses a multi-agent role- playinging system to synthesize infinite tool use training data, boosting a 32 billion parameter models accuracy on function calling benchmarks from 19.8% 8% to 70.9%. A 258% relative gain that rivals models 10 times its size. Swarms Corp. just dropped Voice Agents, a productionready Python library that unifies OpenAI, 11 Labs, and Grock into one realtime API for building voice AI. It can even let multiple agents talk to each other, like their demo showing two philosopher bots debating the meaning of life using streaming speech. Peaking university's UN group just released the full training code for Ultrashape 1.0, a two-stage pipeline that turns images into crisp, watertight 3D models using Voxal condition diffusion. Trained entirely on public data, it democratizes highfidelity 3D generation. Manis's new Slack connector lets teams tag its AI agents directly in threads, turning channel discussions into productionready reports, presentations, and spreadsheets in minutes instead of hours. Vidu AI's video agent is now worldwide, letting anyone create professional videos in 20 languages using 200 voice styles. Just input text or images, and it autogenerates storyboards, scenes, and voiceovers in one click. Microsoft Teams Co-Pilot Chat is now generally available. It automatically turns your calls into AI generated summaries, and action items right in the mobile app, eliminating manual note-taking for good. Nathan Barry just released Tiny Diffusion version 2.0. shrinking the entire diffusion model to just 350 lines of code while adding a tiny GPT implementation that shares 80% of the same architecture. The key difference is switching from causal attention which predicts text one token at a time to birectional attention which lets the model denoise entire sequences in parallel changing literally one line of code. That's it for today's daily epic AI news. Come back tomorrow for more industry updates.
